spring.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the season between winter and summer when leaves and flowers appear
spring.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: It was a cold, sunny day in early spring.
It’s due to open in the spring.
spring.translation[0].definitions[1].def: something, usually a twisted piece of metal, that will return to its previous shape after it has been pressed down
spring.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: an old armchair with broken springs
spring.translation[0].definitions[2].def: the ability of a chair, bed etc to return to its normal shape after being pressed down
spring.translation[0].definitions[3].def: a place where water comes up naturally from the ground
spring.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: There are several hot springs in the area.
spring.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a sudden quick movement or jump in a particular direction
spring.translation[0].note_box[0].items[: You use in spring or in the spring when saying that something happens at this time
In spring the days get longer
She’s coming to visit us in the spring
Don’t use in with these words
They moved here in last spring
The flowers are beautiful this spring
The flowers are beautiful in this spring
They’re getting married in next spring
It rained a lot that spring
It rained a lot in that spring
spring.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping
spring.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: He sprang to his feet (=stood up suddenly) and rushed after her.
One of the young policemen sprang to her assistance.
Tom sprung out of bed and ran downstairs.
Two men sprang out at me as I was walking through the park.
spring.translation[1].definitions[0].not: Spring is used mostly in literature. In everyday English, people usually say jump:
spring.translation[1].definitions[1].def: if something springs back, open etc, it moves quickly, suddenly, and with force, especially after being pushed down or sideways
spring.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The gate sprang shut behind them.
The branch sprang back and hit him in the face.
spring.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to help someone escape from prison
